question: Give the IUPAC name for the compound.<image 1>
description:
The image shows a structural formula of an organic molecule. The molecule consists of five carbon atoms in a chain. The first carbon atom (from left to right) is bonded to three hydrogen atoms. The second carbon atom is bonded to two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom, forming a double bond between the second and third carbon atoms. The third carbon atom is bonded to two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom, which is part of the double bond with the second carbon atom. The fourth carbon atom is bonded to two hydrogen atoms. The fifth carbon atom is bonded to three hydrogen atoms. The oxygen atom is double-bonded to the third carbon atom, indicating a ketone functional group.

Based on this description, the IUPAC name for the compound is:

C. 3-pentanone
